name: DAMP
paper: Matrix Profile XXIV: Scaling Time Series Anomaly Detection to Trillions of Datapoints and Ultra-fast Arriving Data Streams. Proceedings of the 28th ACM SIGKDD
description: DAMP is a matrix-profile–based anomaly detection algorithm designed to efficiently discover discords in large-scale time series. It overcomes limitations such as the twin-freak problem and supports both batch and streaming scenarios, enabling scalable detection from millions to trillions of data points.
bibtex: @inproceedings{10.1145/3534678.3539271, author = {Lu, Yue and Wu, Renjie and Mueen, Abdullah and Zuluaga, Maria A. and Keogh, Eamonn}, title = {Matrix Profile XXIV: Scaling Time Series Anomaly Detection to Trillions of Datapoints and Ultra-fast Arriving Data Streams}, year = {2022}, isbn = {9781450393850}, publisher = {Association for Computing Machinery}, address = {New York, NY, USA}, url = {https://doi.org/10.1145/3534678.3539271}, doi = {10.1145/3534678.3539271}, booktitle = {Proceedings of the 28th ACM SIGKDD Conference on Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining}, pages = {1173–1182}, numpages = {10}, location = {Washington DC, USA}, series = {KDD '22} }
